a.title: Legend for this format

definition.value: "Initial Public Health Case Report" standard for use in reporting from Electronic Health Records (EHR) to health departments.

comment.value: CSTE Element Name: Electronic Initial Case Report (eICR).

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.value: The date on which the reporting party(e.g., physician, nurse practitioner,physician assistant, etc.), completescollection of minimum data for theeICR.

comment.value: CSTE Element Name: Date of the Report.

requirements.value: Used to assess timelines of eICR dataprovisioning, and other qualityassurance tasks.

definition.value: The date and time at which the EHRsystem sends the eICR data to thejurisdictional public health agency ordesignee.

comment.value: CSTE Element Name: Report Submission Date/Time.

requirements.value: Used to ensure timeliness of report andto identify time lags between date of thereport and when the EHR sends thereport.

definition.value: The name of the sending application.

requirements.value: Used to ensure quality and integrity ofeICR data.

definition.value: The Provider responsible for Paitent's care.
Identification code for the care provider(e.g., NPI).

requirements.value: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

definition.value: The first and last name of thehealthcare provider.

requirements.value: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

definition.value: The provider's phone number with areacode.

requirements.value: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

definition.value: The provider's fax number with areacode.

requirements.value: Necessary to obtain additional infoduring case follow-up phase or tosubmit supplemental information.

definition.value: The provider's email address.

requirements.value: If secure email is available; used forsharing secure links to health data ifallowed by state regulations.

definition.value: The provider facility's full name, notnecessarily where care was provided topatient.

comment.value: CSTE Element Name: Provider Facility/Office Name.

requirements.value: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

requirements.value: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

definition.value: The facility sending the EICR.
Identification code for the facility (e.g., Facility NPI).

comment.value: CSTE Element Name: Facility ID Number.

requirements.value: Need provider's contact information in order to follow up appropriately for reportable event to ensure appropriate treatment, identify contact exposures, etc.

definition.value: The facility's name.

definition.value: The type of facility where patient received or is receiving healthcare for the reportable condition (e.g., hospital, ambulatory, urgent care, etc.).

requirements.value: Used to determine the type of care setting in which patient is receiving care for the reportable condition.

definition.value: The facility's phone number with area code.

requirements.value: Need provider's contact information in order to follow up appropriately for reportable event to ensure appropriate treatment, identify contact exposures, etc.

requirements.value: Identification and contact; jurisdicti may select which they can receive based on laws governing public health data exchange.

definition.value: Encounter Information.
Date and time of the provider's most recent encounter with the patient regarding the reportable condition.

requirements.value: Defines when the individual may have been ill; a point in time to which can link other potential cases of reportable event; necessary to ensure follow-up within key time frames/helps triage priority follow-up and ensure control measures are implemented in a timely way.

definition.value: Whether patient is outpatient, inpatient, emergency, urgent care.
Date and time when the patient was admitted to the treatment facility; e.g., hospital.

requirements.value: Key for epidemiologic investigation - important to know if hospitalized for severity of condition and to triage priority follow-up.

requirements.value: Key for epidemiologic investigation - important to know if hospitalized for severity of condition and to triage priority follow-up.
